snippet: Despite increasing pressure, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki of Iraq said he would not give up his claim to forming a new government and holding on to the prime minister’s post.
abstract: Iraq's Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki says he will press ahead in Iraqi courts with his bid to retain power, and will not turn to the army.

byline.contributor: Ali Hamza contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Despite increasing pressure, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki of Iraq said he would not give up his claim to forming a new government and holding on to the prime minister’s post.

headline.main: Maliki Plans to Carry Bid for Power to Iraq Courts
headline.print_headline: Maliki Plans to Carry Bid for Power to Iraq Courts
